Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2015 06:38PM MikaJ wrote: JJMama, I'm so happy for ya! I nursed my kiddo for four years (we practiced child-lead weaning, which basically meant I waited him out...!) I used to get mastitis a lot and, this is really weird, but cold cabbage leaves against the breast to 'draw out' the heat and pain were very effective. I smelled like borscht but it worked for me so on the very off chance that plugged ducts are part of the problem, consider cabbage leaves....!
Posts.Title: I cried today.... JJMAMA Moderators

Posts.Content: Apr 27, 2015 06:59PM MikaJ wrote: We're all stronger than we think, it seems. I've been diagnosed but the extent is unknown and it totally feels like the world is ending AND I'M NOT READY FOR THE WORLD TO END. And of course, the thing is, the world's not ending - lots and lots and LOTS of women have gone through what we're going through, and are now living long and happy lives and sharing their strength with us. You'll get through this, I'll get through this, and our kids will have the best mommas around for years and years to come. BIG HUGS!
Posts.Title: I'm falling apart. Can't handle all of this Katie00 Scottiemom11
